body_html:
@peterjc123
"Avoid infinite recursion in __getattribute__ and __setattr__ by using methods from super() (i.e., the object class) to access instance attributes directly."

In the reference Effective Python: 59 Specific Ways to Write Better Python, see Item 32

Or see
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13538324/python-avoiding-infinite-loops-in-getattribute

I think the code

    def __setstate__(self, state):
        self.__dict__ = state

    def __getstate__(self):
        return self.__dict__

should work well here.

body:
@peterjc123 
"Avoid infinite recursion in `__getattribute__` and `__setattr__` by using methods from super() (i.e., the object class) to access instance attributes directly."

In the reference *Effective Python: 59 Specific Ways to Write Better Python*, see **Item 32**

Or see
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13538324/python-avoiding-infinite-loops-in-getattribute

I think the code
```python
    def __setstate__(self, state):
        self.__dict__ = state

    def __getstate__(self):
        return self.__dict__
```
should work well here.
